docs.snippet: People who knew the 18-year-old Taiwanese exchange student charged in the U.S. with threatening to shoot up his school say he liked guns and flamethrowers and had dreams of a police career.

headline.print_headline: Taiwan Suspect in US School Attack Plot Had 'Unusual Ideas'
headline.main: Taiwan Suspect in US School Attack Plot Had 'Unusual Ideas'

docs.snippet: The turbulent start to 2018 in financial markets has finally brought an end to one of the longest ever global bull runs - and there have been few places to hide.

headline.print_headline: Global Market Bull Runs Out of Charge in First Quarter
headline.main: Global Market Bull Runs Out of Charge in First Quarter

docs.snippet: The Iowa Supreme Court on Friday upheld the conviction of a high school teacher who claimed his only physical contact with the student was hugging, finding that the hugging amounted to sexual misconduct in light of instant messages that showed she...

headline.print_headline: Iowa High Court Says Teacher's Hugs With Student Were Sexual
headline.main: Iowa High Court Says Teacher's Hugs With Student Were Sexual

docs.snippet: The death of Amia Tyrae, 28, in Baton Rouge, La., has been ruled a homicide. Violence against transgender people disproportionately affects women of color like her.

headline.print_headline: Transgender Woman Shot Dead in Motel Is 7th Killed in U.S. This Year, Rights Advocates Say
headline.main: Transgender Woman Shot Dead in Motel Is 7th Killed in U.S. This Year, Rights Advocates Say

docs.snippet: Global proceeds from initial public offerings (IPO) rose to $39 billion (£27.8 billion) in the first quarter of 2018, the highest since 2014, as companies rushed to take advantage of generally strong equity markets and robust economic growth ...

headline.print_headline: Global IPO Proceeds Hit Four Year High in First Quarter
headline.main: Global IPO Proceeds Hit Four Year High in First Quarter

docs.snippet: A Thai editor faces possible criminal charges for sharing a student's "disrespectful" picture of historic kings wearing face masks to highlight air pollution in the northern city of Chiang Mai.

headline.print_headline: Thai Editor Faces Charges Over Picture of Kings Wearing Masks
headline.main: Thai Editor Faces Charges Over Picture of Kings Wearing Masks

docs.snippet: Your daily look at late-breaking news, upcoming events and the stories that will be talked about Friday:
A Connecticut lawmaker accused of sending affectionate text messages to a 16-year-old girl resigned Thursday, three weeks after he told House Democratic leaders he would be doing so.

headline.print_headline: Hartford Lawmaker Officially Resigns Over Texts Sent to Teen
headline.main: Hartford Lawmaker Officially Resigns Over Texts Sent to Teen

docs.snippet: The suspect in the Florida high school shooting that killed 17 is getting letters of support in jail including fan mail and pictures of scantily-clad women in addition to hundreds of dollars in contributions to his commissary account.

headline.print_headline: Florida School Shooting Suspect Gets 'Piles' of Fan Letters
headline.main: Florida School Shooting Suspect Gets 'Piles' of Fan Letters

docs.snippet: Oklahoma's Senate on Wednesday approved legislation for the first major tax increase in a quarter century to help fund pay raises for teachers and avert a strike.

headline.print_headline: Oklahoma Approves Tax Hike to Avert Teachers' Strike
headline.main: Oklahoma Approves Tax Hike to Avert Teachers' Strike
